thread.title: LaSalle's Larkin on watch list for national player of year
thread.title_full: LaSalle's Larkin on watch list for national player of year

title: LaSalle's Larkin on watch list for national player of year
text:
LaSalle's Larkin on watch list for national player of year 
Updated: Wed, Sep 30 2015, 02:21 PM 
CINCINNATI (WKRC) -- LaSalle High School running back Jeremy Larkin is one of 10 players listed on the watch list for the MaxPreps National Player of the Year. 
In the Lancers' first five games this season the senior, who has committed to the University of Cincinnati, has rushed for 739 yards on only 61 carries (12.1 yards per carry average) and 10 touchdowns, has six receptions for 182 yards and two touchdowns and added four two-point conversions for 80 total points scored. 
LaSalle is 5-0 and ranked nationally in the both the MaxPreps XCellent 25 and USA Today Super 25. 
The Lancers play Greater Catholic League South Division rival Moeller at Lockland this Friday. 
Here is a link to some highlights of Larkin from the Kroger Saturday High School Rivals presented by Kelsey Chevrolet Game of the Week on Star64 a couple of weeks ago.
